Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a healthy plant, clearly depicting it with vibrant green leaves and a strong, upright stem, and describe that it needs water and light to live.
The student can effectively draw a plant without water, showing it with wilted leaves and a drooping stem to indicate poor health.
The student can illustrate the stark differences between well-watered and dry plants, effectively demonstrating that plants cannot thrive without water.
The student can use patterns or comparative elements in their drawings to effectively explain the critical role of water in the growth and health of plants.
The student can include detailed observations or real-life examples in their illustrations that demonstrate their understanding of plant needs.
CANNOT: The student may have minor inconsistencies in labeling, such as forgetting to label all parts of the plant consistently (e.g., missing one label for a leaf).
The student might occasionally overemphasize the role of water compared to light (e.g., depicting an overly dramatic difference only due to water, despite light also being vital).
